content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

You can use the following code to create a Julia function called "add_yearmonth" that adds a new column "ym" to the DataFrame df, where it extracts year and month from the DateTimes represented by "dt" and concatenates them together as an integer in format "yyyymm":
```julia
using Dates
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    new_col = []
    for i in 1:size(df, 1)
        dt = df.dt[i] # get current datetime value
        ym = string(Year(dt)) * string(Month(dt)) # create new yyyymm string
        push!(new_col, parse(Int64, ym)) # convert to integer and push to new column array
    end
    return hcat([df; DataFrame(ym = new_col)]) # return a new dataframe with the added column
end
```
To use this function, you can simply call it with your DataFrame `df` as an argument:
```julia
df = add_yearmonth(df)
```
